newsitem.title: USA: Pacific Gas selects CellNet product.
newsitem.headline: Pacific Gas selects CellNet product.

text.p: Pacific Gas and Electric Co said Wednesday it signed an agreement with CellNet Data Systems Inc to install its automated meter reading system for an information technology demonstration project.

Under the multi-year agreement, installation of the CellNet Network Meter Reading system will begin in December for some residential, commercial and industrial customers in PG&E's Delta District in eastern Contra Costa County, Calif.
By mid-1997, PG&E plans to use CellNet's wireless network to read approximately 55,000 electric and 45,000 gas meters.

"This new technology may lead to enhanced customer services such as automated outage detection, more timely service restoration, and more flexible billing and payment options," PG&E Information Technology Program Manager Ron Williams, said in a statement.
As PG&E evaluates the system, it may consider moving forward with additional automated meter reading projects.
